conclusion: Consider the forces on each section of the wire and the symmetry of the situation.
Current will be distributed equally between the two paths from A to B due to uniform resistivity and symmetry.
Ampere's Force Law: F = I (L × B).
Force on AB is F since the current through AB is half the total current.
Force on AC or CB is F' = (I/2) L B sin(θ) and forces are equal in magnitude and direction.
Perpendicular components of forces on AC and CB add up to contribute to the resultant force.
Total resultant force perpendicular to AB is F_resultant = I L B √3/2.
Total resultant force on the frame is F_total = F + I L B √3/2.
Express total force in terms of F: F_total = F + F √3.
Magnitude of the resultant Ampere force on the three resistance wires is F + F √3.
